alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 7:11PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Below Abiquiu Dam affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Rio Chama near Chamita. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MDT Friday the stage was 6.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 6.6 feet. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Rio Chama Chamita 8.0 6.6 Fri 6 pm MDT 6.6 6.6 6.6 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning around 900 AM MDT.
